Description: Papyrus (two fragments) written with black ink with demotic legal text on recto (15 ll.), verso pasted down. This papyrus seems to be a draft of P BM EA 10533. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "Transfer of rights in a 1/3 part share of orchard land by Harpoeris(?) son of Nechtf to Petearsemtheus son of Panobchunis. Date. lost: [year 29 Ptol. Alexander = BC. 96, from no. 10533]". Concerning this group of texts, see entry for P BM EA 10491.
Curator's comments: Cf. entry in www.trismegistos.org - DAHT. Edited in S.E. Thomas Cambridge PhD diss. Text 26 in Shore's Manuscript Catalogue of Demotic Gebelein Papyri in the British Museum. Publication in progress (S.E. Thomas).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (621) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/621)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss, fractured, bloom Black ink Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Binding Self adhesive linen tape Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
